item.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to Vectors and Matrices
item.description:
What is a Vector?

A vector in machine learning is typically an array of numbers that represent a point in a high-dimensional space. For example, a feature set of a house (size, age, location score) could be represented as a vector $v = (1500, 10, 0.9)$.

What is a Matrix?

A matrix is a collection of vectors, often used to store datasets. If we have 100 houses, our data would be a matrix of size $100 \times 3$.

item.title: Linux Commands for AI
item.description:
Welcome to my Linux section! I’ll be documenting my journey through the basic Linux commands to get familiar with Linux CLI here.

Mastering the Linux command line (CLI) is a superpower for developers. It allows you to automate tasks, manage servers, and debug issues faster than any graphical interface.

Here is a curated list of commands essential for a professional workflow, organized by use case.

  1. Navigation & File ManagementYou likely know cd and ls, but professional environments require efficiency and precision.

  • ls -lah: The gold standard for listing files.-l: List in long format (permissions, owner, size).

item.title: Python Basics for AI
item.description: My foundational learning in Coding starting with Linux Commands, Python, Py Packages for AI ML.
